p: Tissue culture selection studies have shown that a V106M mutation commonly develops in subtype C viruses following drug pressure with NVP or EFV, unlike the V106A mutation that is more commonly selected in subtype B. The basis for this difference is a nucleotide polymorphism at codon 106 in reverse transcriptase (RT) [ 45– 46]. The clinical importance of the V106M mutation in non-B subtypes has been confirmed in recent years with six studies showing that V106M is frequently seen in non-B subtypes (C and CRF01_AE) after therapy with EFV or NVP [ 23, 25, 27, 47– 50].
